title: Sales Operations Data Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a detail-oriented Sales Operations VA to manage incoming orders, maintain accurate records, and support coordination between customers, warehouses, and shippers. The ideal candidate will ensure smooth order flow from inbox to fulfillment, ensuring communication is clear and data is kept up-to-date.



Key Responsibilities:

- Order Processing: Receive customer orders via
 and input them into the system.

- Fulfillment Coordination: Validate stock, create fulfillment requests, and track orders from start to delivery.

- Shipping Coordination: Collaborate with warehouses and shipping partners for pickups and dispatch.

- Shipment Monitoring: Track PODs, handle basic shipment claims, and escalate issues as necessary.

- Record Maintenance: Organize and maintain records, reports, and dashboards for visibility.



Mandatory Skills:

- Strong attention to detail and process discipline.

- Excellent written and spoken communication in English.

- Comfortable working with spreadsheets and order management or CRM tools.

- Ability to prioritize tasks, follow SOPs, and meet daily turnaround targets.

- Familiarity with order processing and fulfillment cycles.

- Strong time management skills and the ability to work efficiently under pressure.



Preferred Skills:

- Experience in sales operations, order entry, or customer service.

- Knowledge of shipment tracking, POD workflows, and handling basic claims.

- Exposure to US markets and
 ticketing systems.

- Proficiency in CRM tools such as Salesforce or HubSpot.

- Familiarity with e-commerce platforms like Shopify or Amazon Seller Central.



Why Join Us:

- Well-defined processes and a supportive management team.

- Opportunities for professional growth while contributing to meaningful work.

- Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency of our operations.

title: Ecommerce Operations Manager – Print-on-Demand Apparel (Printful, Ecwid, Etsy)
description:
Remote | Full-time preferred (30–40 hrs/week)



Overview



We are hiring a hands-on Ecommerce Operations Manager to run the day-to-day operations of a print-on-demand apparel brand.



Our store is built on Ecwid, uses Printful for production and fulfillment, and is expanding to Etsy and additional marketplaces. You will be responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle, from product creation to marketplace listings and ongoing optimization.



This role is for someone who can work independently, make decisions, and keep the store running smoothly without constant direction.



Core Responsibilities

Store Ownership & Operations



Take full ownership of the ecommerce store’s daily operations



Manage product creation, listings, updates, and removals



Ensure the store is always accurate, organized, and professional



Proactively identify and fix issues without being asked



Print-on-Demand Management (Printful)



Create, manage, and optimize products in Printful



Set correct print placements, sizing, variants, and files



Ensure seamless syncing between Printful and Ecwid



Monitor product quality and resolve production issues



Product Design & Mockups



Prepare designs and adjust artwork for different apparel products



Create high-quality mockups using:



Printful mockup generator



Canva / Placeit / Photoshop



Ensure all product images meet brand and platform standards



Ecwid Store Management



Manage the entire Ecwid catalog:



Pricing



SKUs



Variants



Categories



Write and maintain clear, accurate product descriptions



Ensure consistent branding across all listings



Marketplace Expansion & Management



Launch and manage products on Etsy



Optimize listings (titles, descriptions, tags, images)



Ensure compliance with marketplace rules



Expand to additional marketplaces over time (Amazon, eBay, etc.)



Quality Control & Optimization



Review store performance and product presentation



Improve existing listings based on performance



Maintain clean workflows and documentation



Keep everything organized and scalable



Required Experience



Non-Negotiable:



Proven experience running a print-on-demand apparel store



Hands-on experience with Printful



Experience with Ecwid or similar ecommerce platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce)



Experience managing Etsy product listings



Strong product and visual judgment



Strongly Preferred:



Canva / Placeit / Photoshop



Basic understanding of ecommerce pricing and margins



Experience managing multiple marketplaces



What Success Looks Like



Store runs smoothly without daily oversight



Products are consistently launched correctly and on time



Listings look professional and conversion-ready



Marketplaces stay organized and compliant



Owner involvement decreases over time



How to Apply



Please include:



Print-on-demand stores you have run or managed



Platforms you have experience with (Printful, Ecwid, Etsy, etc.)



Examples of product listings and mockups you created



A brief explanation of how you would manage a POD store day-to-day



Applications without direct POD management experience will not be considered.

title: Program Content & Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
Enlightened Wellness is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and self-directed Content & Operations Virtual Assistant to support the management, organization, editing, and publishing of educational materials for our professional certification program.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in structured environments, enjoys creating order from complex content, and takes pride in accuracy, consistency, and follow-through. You will own the day-to-day content workflow that keeps our certification program organized, up to date, and running smoothly.



We are looking for a long-term team member who wants to grow with the company, take responsibility for systems, and become deeply familiar with our content and processes.



Key Responsibilities



1. Certification Content Ownership

Organize, label, and manage video, audio, and written course materials

Maintain clean file structures, naming conventions, and version control

Track content from recording ? editing ? approval ? publication

Ensure all materials are accurate, complete, and correctly placed



2. Editing & Publishing

Perform basic video editing using Descript (trimming, captions, word corrections)

Review content for clarity and accuract

Upload finalized materials into Thinkific following established SOPs

Format lessons, modules, and resources consistently

Ensure branding consistency across all content

Edit slides in Canva, and docuements in google docs



3. Systems & Platform Management

Work inside:

Thinkific

Canva

Descript

Google Drive & Google Sheets

Maintain tracking spreadsheets and content logs

Learn and adapt to new tools and systems as needed



4. Quality Control & Workflow Execution

Double-check all uploads for errors before publishing

Follow detailed SOPs without reminders

Identify missing content, inconsistencies, or errors and resolve them proactively

Suggest improvements to workflows when appropriate



5. Communication & Accountability

Communicate clearly and professionally

Provide updates on progress and deadlines

Ask clarifying questions when instructions are unclear

Take ownership of tasks from start to finish



QualificationsRequired Skills & Experience

Exceptional organizational and time management skills

Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and quality control

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines without micromanagement

Comfort managing complex digital files, naming systems, and version control

Strong technical aptitude and ability to quickly learn new platforms

Experience working inside online systems, and project tools

Ability to follow detailed instructions precisely

Comfortable with repetitive, detail-heavy work that requires consistency

Excellent written and spoken English, with strong grammar and editing skills

Demonstrated reliability, professionalism, and strong work ethic



Work Style & Personal Traits

Self-starter who takes initiative and ownership of work

High sense of urgency and responsibility

Proactive problem-solver who does not wait to be told what to fix

Open to feedback and continuous improvement

Able to manage workload responsibly without overcommitting to other clients



Who This Role Is (and Is Not) For

This role is best suited for someone who enjoys structure, systems, and precision and is looking for long-term, consistent work with room to grow.



Position Details

Hours: 15 hours per week to start

Growth: Opportunity for increased hours over time

Schedule: Flexible

Location: Remote



Application Instructions (Required)

To ensure a strong fit, applicants must follow all instructions carefully.

Use the subject line:

CONTENT VA – READY TO ORGANIZE

At the top of your application, answer this question (2–3 sentences):

What does attention to detail look like in your daily work?

Include:

Resume

Relevant work samples (if available)

Weekly availability

Current number of clients or ongoing projects

Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.



Why Join Us

You’ll be joining a mission-driven organization focused on education, excellence, and long-term impact. Your work will directly support the growth and quality of our certification program, and you’ll have the opportunity to take on increasing responsibility over time.

title: Customer Success & Onboarding Assistant (Barber / Stylist App)
description:
We are looking for a friendly and detail-oriented Customer Success & Onboarding Assistant to help new barbers and stylists get started with our booking apps (Ring My Barber / Ring My Stylist).



Your role is to make sure new users feel supported, understand the app, and have well-set-up accounts.



What you’ll do



- Review newly registered barber/stylist accounts

- Help users complete and improve their profiles (services, prices, availability, photos)

- Respond to in-app messages in a friendly and professional way

- Proactively reach out to new users to ask how the app is going

- Collect feedback, questions, and common issues

- Report insights and suggestions to our team



Requirements



- Very good written English

- Friendly, patient, and proactive communicator

- Comfortable messaging users first (not just replying)

- Detail-oriented and organized

- Reliable internet connection

- Experience with customer support, onboarding, or virtual assistance is a plus



Work details



- Remote

- Part-time to start (with potential to grow)

- Long-term position



Question 1 

A barber signs up but does not complete their profile or add services. How would you approach helping them?

Question 2

Write a short, friendly message you would send to a new user to ask how their experience with the app has been so far.

title: Product lister/rescreachs
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing e-commerce store focused on building scalable, high-performing products. Our current best-selling category is pillows within the sleep niche, but we are expanding beyond a single niche. We focus on strong positioning, conversion-driven pages and data-backed decision making.



About the Role

We are not looking for a basic product lister. We are looking for someone who takes ownership of product-level performance. In this role, you are responsible for finding, analyzing and scaling winning products. This includes identifying opportunities both inside and outside our current niche.



You will build complete product pages from A to Z, create high-converting pre-landers that align with ad angles, and develop scalable product templates that are ready to test and scale.



You don’t build pages. You build revenue-generating assets.



What You’ll Do

Identify products with strong scaling potential, niche-independent.

Analyze competitors and turn insights into stronger positioning.

Build full product pages with a clear conversion structure.

Create pre-landers focused on pain points, emotion and ad angles.

Optimize bundles and upsells to increase average order value.

Develop scalable product templates for fast product launches.

Work closely with marketing to test hooks and angles.



How You’ll Be Measured

Conversion rate of product pages.

Average order value growth.

Win rate of tested products.

Speed and quality of new product launches.

Pre-lander performance in combination with ads.



Who You Are

You have proven experience in product research within e-commerce.

You understand how to build product pages and pre-landers that convert.

You think in numbers, testing and optimization.

You work independently and take responsibility for results.

You are comfortable working with performance targets.



What You Get

Direct impact on revenue and scalability.

High ownership and freedom.

A performance-driven environment where results matter.

Growth opportunities toward product strategy or performance marketing.



Important

We only respond to candidates who can provide proven cases or measurable results. This includes conversion rates, AOV improvements, winning products, or clear performance metrics you have achieved.



To confirm you have fully read this post, include the word “Scale” at the bottom of your application.

title: Amazon FBA Product Sourcer/Ungating Specialist
description:
Amazon FBA Product Sourcer / Ungating Specialist (Part-Time)

Do not apply if you cannot ungate products or brands.

I'm a newer Amazon FBA seller looking for a serious, experienced product sourcer who can consistently find profitable, ungated opportunities and understands how to work with newer accounts.

Responsibilities

*   Find profitable wholesale / online arbitrage products

*   Identify ungated ASINs and brands suitable for a newer FBA account

*   Assist with or independently complete ungating applications

*   Provide clear sourcing spreadsheets including: Buy cost, sell price, ROl, profit, source, etc.

*   Sales rank / demand

*   Gating status proof

*   Research suppliers that are Amazon-friendly



REQUIREMENTS (Read Carefully)

*   Proven experience ungating categories and/or brands

*   Must understand Amazon restrictions for new seller accounts

*   Must show real examples of:  Brands you have ungated

*   Products you've successfully sourced and sold

*   No guessing, no recycled leads, no "it's hard to ungate" excuses

*   Strong English communication

*   Honest, proactive, self-sufficient, organized and transparent

Nice to Have

*   Experience with new FBA accounts

*   Familiar with Keepa, SellerAmp, Amazon Seller Central

*   Ability to explain why a product is worth buying



TO APPLY

Start your application with:

"I have ungated brands before."

Then include:

1.    Brands/categories you've personally ungated

2.    Your sourcing method (OA, wholesale, etc.)

3.    Screenshots or examples (no confidential info)

4.    Why you're confident working with a new seller account

Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored
salary: depends on experience. paid per hour

title: Accountant (UK-based Client)
description:
Job Overview

HARON Ltd is looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Accountant to support a UK-based client on a long-term, full-time basis. This role focuses on day-to-day UK bookkeeping, VAT preparation, and management reporting, ensuring accurate and compliant financial records.



The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with UK accounting processes, is confident working independently in a remote setup, and can provide clear, timely financial information to support management decision-making.



Key Responsibilities

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date bookkeeping records using Xero

- Perform bank, credit card, and balance sheet reconciliations

- Prepare monthly management accounts (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

- Prepare and submit quarterly UK VAT returns

- Monitor accounts payable and receivable, including invoicing and payment tracking

- Track expenses, budgets, and cash flow to support financial planning

- Assist with year-end preparation and coordination with external accountants

- Support HMRC compliance by ensuring records are complete and audit-ready

- Improve and maintain internal accounting processes and controls



Qualifications & Requirements

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

- Minimum 2 years of hands-on UK accounting experience (required)

- Strong working knowledge of: 

      - UK bookkeeping practices

      - VAT preparation and submissions

      - Financial statement preparation

- Proficiency in Xero (required)

- Experience using TaxCalc or similar UK tax software is an advantage

- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

- Excellent written and spoken English communication skills

- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a remote environment

- Provide clear financial summaries and insights to management when required



Nice to Have (but not required)

- Experience supporting UK-based SMEs

- Exposure to payroll coordination (not primary responsibility)

- Familiarity with Google Sheets and cloud-based workflows



Why Join Us

- Long-term, stable role with a UK-based client

- Fully remote setup

- Opportunity to work closely with management and influence financial processes

- Supportive, people-first working culture



How to Apply

- Please send your updated CV to 

-
 subject: Application for Accountant 2026 – [Your Name] 

- Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Amazon FBA lead sourcer
description:
I am looking for an experienced Amazon FBA Online Arbitrage (OA) Product Researcher who can provide high-quality, profitable leads consistently. This is for US marketplace sourcing only. If you have experience analyzing products using Keepa and SellerAmp (SAS), I want to work with you.



?



???? Responsibilities

 • Find profitable, ungated OA leads for Amazon FBA (U.S.).

 • Use Keepa to analyze price history, sales rank, buy box stability, and consistency.

 • Review offers using SellerAmp (SAS) including ROI, profit margin, eligibility, oversize checks, hazmat, and competition.

 • Source leads from retail websites, brand sites, and suppliers.

 • Avoid restricted brands and IP-complaint-prone items.

 • Provide leads in a clean spreadsheet format including:

 • Amazon ASIN & link

 • Source store link

 • Buy cost

 • Sell price

 • Profit

 • ROI%

 • Keepa screenshot or chart explanation

 • Notes (coupons, variations, limits, etc.)



?



???? Requirements

 • Must have experience in Amazon OA product research

 • Strong knowledge of Keepa (required)

 • Strong knowledge of SellerAmp / SAS (preferred)

 • Understanding of ROI, profit margin, buy box, and sales rank

 • Fast and reliable internet connection

 • Good English communication

 • Ability to follow criteria and deliver consistent leads

 • Honest, reliable, and able to work independently



?



???? Lead Criteria



Only submit leads that match:

 • Minimum $3 profit

 • Minimum 30% ROI

 • Keepa shows stable price + demand

 • No Amazon domination

 • No IP-complaint brands

 • Must be in-stock at both Amazon & supplier

 • 20+ estimated sales per month preferred



(You can adjust this part if your criteria differ.)



?



???? Payment Structure



I pay Per accepted lead

 • In rare cases hourly 





Please include in your application:

 1. Your preferred payment method (PayPal, Wise, etc.)

 2. The payment structure you want (per lead, hourly, weekly)

 3. Your current rate

 4. A short explanation of your past Amazon OA experience

 5. 1–2 sample leads you’ve previously found (optional but preferred)



?



???? How to Apply



To ensure you read the full job post, start your message with the word “ORANGE.”

Applications without this will not be considered.



Then include:

 • Your name

 • Your experience level

 • Tools you have used (Keepa, SAS, RevSeller, etc.)

 • Your payment preference

 • Why you think you’re a good fit

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We are seeking an exceptionally organized, detail-driven Executive Assistant to support the Founder & CEO of a growing aerospace company. This is a critical, trusted role for someone who takes pride in protecting executive focus, ensuring priorities are clear, and making sure nothing important slips.



The right candidate enjoys owning systems, anticipating needs, and creating order in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment. This is not a passive support role. You will serve as the central point of control for the CEO’s calendar, communications, travel logistics, and follow-through, while also improving how information, tasks, and decisions flow across the business.



This role requires sound judgment, independent thinking, and the ability to design better ways of working over time. The EA is expected to use modern productivity tools, including AI, to increase clarity, efficiency, and execution quality—while maintaining discretion and human judgment.



This is a long-term, remote position requiring availability during Central Time business hours, with flexibility for occasional evenings or weekends during travel, trade shows, or key deadlines.

title: Video Contributor
description:
This project focuses on collecting first-person (POV) video to train AI and robotics models. As a contributor, you will record POV footage of your everyday household and work activities using a head-mounted iPhone and our specific recording application. 

Contributors from any country are welcome to participate. You must already have or be willing to purchase an iPhone 11 or newer and a head-mount for it.





Recording should be done with a head mount—?neck and chest mounts are not acceptable.

Each video you upload must be of a specific task, and NOT a mix of tasks. For example, one video upload should not have you doing both cooking and laundry. Instead, you should record separate videos of cooking and then doing the laundry, and upload both separately. 

Ideally, you should record a mix of tasks between 15-30 minutes long. 

The space where you record your video should have excellent lighting.  

Keep the camera steady with minimal shaking.

All submitted footage must exclude any other individuals' faces unless they directly consent. Additionally, no third party music is permitted in the footage to avoid copyright violations.

No children should appear in the submitted footage.

Minimize external noise during the recording–especially talking–so the audio of the task can be captured clearly and keep the camera as steady as possible throughout the recording.

Complete each task from start to finish without walking away or leaving to do another task or take a break.

Tasks should be performed while either standing up, sitting on a chair/stool, not while sitting on the ground.

Perform all activities in a controlled, slow manner. 

To ensure that your footage meets the criteria mentioned above, before making your first official upload, you may need to record a few samples and then use the preview feature to watch them in the app and then discard them, since we currently do not have a way for you to see your footage as it's being recorded.

title: Client Success Specialist
description:
Strong Arm Media is a growing real estate media company based in Northern Virginia, United States. We help real estate agents win listings, market homes better, and look more professional in front of their clients.



We are looking for a Client Success Specialist to be the first point of contact for our clients. This role is the digital front desk of our company. You will be the friendly, reliable voice that clients trust and enjoy working with.



What You Will Be Doing



As a Client Success Specialist, you will be the primary point of contact for our clients during business hours, acting as the digital front desk for Strong Arm Media. You will handle incoming calls, texts, and
s, manage the shooting calendar, and guide clients through their orders with clarity and confidence. A big part of this role is building real relationships, welcoming new clients, checking in with existing ones, and helping clients feel supported and taken care of from start to finish. You will also assist with light upselling when appropriate, keep internal communication organized, and make sure the right information gets to the right people at the right time.



Ideal Candidate



The ideal candidate is friendly, organized, and genuinely enjoys talking with people. You are comfortable on the phone, communicate clearly in English, and know how to balance professionalism with a warm, approachable tone. You pay close attention to details, respond quickly, and stay calm when things get busy. You enjoy systems, follow processes well, and are confident learning new software tools. Most importantly, you care about doing things the right way and want to grow with a company long term, not just fill a temporary role.



To show that you’ve read this entire job post, please include the phrase “StrongArm Ready” somewhere in your application or cover message.

Strong understanding of B2B prospecting, data enrichment tools, and CRM workflows (Salesforce/HubSpot).

Looking for a driven, hard-working individual who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.

title: Hybrid Operations & Inventory Manager - ZLUX Studio (Salon & Jewelry)
description:
Job Title: Hybrid Operations & Inventory Manager – ZLUX Studio (Salon & Jewelry)

Location: Remote (Home-based) + Monthly On-site Audit in Quezon City

Job Type: Part-Time (15–20 hours per week)

Salary: ?15,000 – ?20,000 per month (depending on experience) + Transpo Allowance for on-site days



About the Role



ZLUX Studio is a premier salon and creative sanctuary in Quezon City. Single store (with goals for multiple branch expansion), 30sqm in size. We are expanding into a signature gemstone jewelry collection and a premiu
mbership program (ZLUX Infinite). We are looking for a sharp, organized "back-end" partner to manage our systems so our on-site team can focus on beauty.



Key Responsibilities

 * Weekly Payroll & Commissions: Accurately calculate and manage weekly payouts for 3–4 salon staff based on our tiered "Ritual" service rates.

 * High-Value Inventory: Manage the digital log for our salon products and our Gemstone Jewelry collection.

 * Monthly On-Site Audit: Visit the studio in Quezon City once a month to physically reconcile gemstone beads and salon stock against digital records.

 * Membership Management: Oversee the "ZLUX Infinite" program, ensuring the 33 exclusive members are billed correctly (?7,500/mo) and their bookings are prioritized.

 * Customer Concierge: Handle premium inquiries on
/Instagram with a sophisticated, brand-aligned tone.

Qualifications

 * Location: Must be based in or near Quezon City/Metro Manila to facilitate monthly audits.

 * Experience: Previous experience in retail inventory, payroll, or salon operations is a major plus.

 * Technical Skills: Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel for commission math and inventory logs.

 * Communication: High-level English and Tagalog (written and verbal) to maintain our luxury brand voice.

 * Mindset: "Ownership" energy—you don't just find problems; you fix them.



How to Apply



Please send your resume and a brief introduction. To prove your attention to detail, please include the word "GEMSTONE" in your subject line and answer this question:



"If we have 100 beads in our log but find 92 on the shelf, what is your process for finding the missing 8?"



I hope we are ALIGNED, and good luck.

title: Junior Data Analyst (Marketing & Performance Focus)
description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Marketing & Performance Focus)

Type: Full-time

Compensation: £250-£300/week

Reporting to: Director of Paid Media



WHO WE ARE



Digital Roo is a UK-based lead generation company that partners with financial service brands to deliver high-quality, compliant, and scalable leads.



We combine expert media buying, creative strategy, and automation to help our clients grow predictably across platforms like Meta, Google, Bing, YouTube, and TikTok.



We’re scaling fast — with major growth plans for 2026 — and we’re building a small, world-class team to help us get there.



THE ROLE



Here's the unique opportunity: 

You'll start as our data analyst, but this isn't a "pure analyst" role. This is a pathway to becoming a media buyer.Here's why this works: The best media buyers aren't just button-clickers — they're data detectives who can read campaign performance, spot opportunities, and make smart decisions based on numbers.

Your Journey:

Weeks 1-2: Master our data systems, build dashboards, learn to read campaign metrics inside-out

Weeks 3-6: Shadow media buying, start managing small test campaigns, apply your data insights to real budget decisions

Weeks 6-12: Own your first full campaigns, make optimization decisions, become a data-driven media buyer



You'll learn media buying through the lens of data first — which means you'll understand the "why" behind every decision, not just the "how."



RESPONSIBILITIES



Phase 1: Data Foundation (Weeks 1-2)

* Pull performance data from Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, and other platforms

* Build and maintain tracking dashboards in Google Sheets (and later, Data Studio/Looker)

* Monitor campaign KPIs: CPA, CTR, conversion rate, ROAS, lead quality scores

* Flag any anomalies or performance issues to the media buying team

* Create performance reports that summarize what happened and why

* Identify trends: which ad creatives are winning, which audiences convert best, where we're wasting budget



Phase 2: Media Buying Apprenticeship (Weeks 3-6)

* Shadow our media buying process across Meta, Google, and other platforms

* Set up campaigns using Google Ads Editor and Meta Ads Manager (we'll teach you)

* Monitor daily performance and flag any issues or opportunities

* Learn how to read data: CTR, CPA, conversion rates, and what they mean

* Assist with creative briefing and A/B test tracking



Phase 3: Media Buyer (Weeks 6-12)



* Manage smaller test budgets independently

* Run weekly performance analysis and suggest optimizations

* Collaborate with the creative team to test new ad angles

* Start building "recovery plans" when campaigns underperform

* Own full campaign lifecycles from setup to scale

* Identify new platform opportunities (TikTok, Native, Bing, etc.)

* Present performance insights to clients or internal stakeholders

* Propose and execute growth experiments



YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU…



*  Want to build a career in marketing: You're not just interested in AI for AI's sake — you want to use it to drive real business results

* Are a fast learner: You don't need to know media buying now, but you need to pick things up quickly.

* Love numbers: You're comfortable with spreadsheets and can spot patterns in data.

* Are naturally curious: You ask "why" and "what if" constantly.

* Take ownership: You don't wait to be told what to do — you figure it out.

* Communicate clearly: You can explain your thinking and findings in writing.

* Are proactive: If something's broken, you fix it. If something's unclear, you ask.



REQUIREMENTS



* Strong Google Sheets or Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, data analysis).

* Basic understanding of digital advertising (even if just from using
/Instagram).

* Willingness to learn technical tools: Google Ads Editor, Meta Ads Manager, tracking systems

* English Fluency: Excellent written and spoken English for internal meetings and ad copy testing.

* Analytical Mindset: You must be comfortable with complex data interpretation and presenting findings to the team.

* A strong interest in AI, marketing, and scalable business systems.



Nice to have:

* Any prior experience with paid ads (even personal projects or small freelance work)

* Familiarity with marketing metrics (CPC, CPA, ROAS, CTR, etc.)

* Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini

* Experience in marketing, eCommerce, or analytics roles



Most Important:



* You're hungry to grow and see this as a career opportunity, not just a job

* You're detail-oriented — small mistakes in media buying can cost thousands

* You're resilient — campaigns fail sometimes; you learn and move forward



WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT



* Direct Impact: You’ll be working directly with the paid media director in a high-growth environment. Your decisions will move the needle every single day.

* Continuous Learning: We move fast. You’ll be expected to learn new tools (including AI-driven workflows) and improve your strategy weekly.

* Data-First Culture: We don’t guess. We test, analyze, and iterate. If you love performance marketing, you’ll love our process.

* A-Player Environment: We only hire smart, capable, self-motivated people. There is zero hand-holding here—just ownership and results.









HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please complete our short survey first (link below).

Only applications submitted through the survey will be considered.



>> 



If selected, you’ll receive an invitation to an initial interview.



OUR HIRING PROCESS



1. Survey/Quiz – Complete a short questionnaire to assess fit and attention to detail.

2. Initial Interview – A brief conversation to learn more about you.

3. Paid Test Task – Selected candidates complete a real-world task (2–3 hours) to demonstrate skills.

4. Final Interview & Offer – Final alignment and next-step discussion.

(In some cases, we may bring on multiple candidates for a one-month trial and keep the best performers.)



SUMMARY



If you're someone who loves data, wants to learn strategy, and is ready to grow into a media buying role — this is your opportunity.

You'll start with data, but you won't stay there. Within a year, you could be managing six-figure ad budgets and driving real growth.



>> Apply now by completing the survey linked above.

title: Rock Star Real Estate Cold Caller Needed!!!
description:
Welcome to the application process for Team Kampeon! We are looking to hire the best of the best so be prepared to be a KAMPEON!!!



First of all EXCELLENT English is a MUST, if you don't speak good English don't apply!

You will be on the phone the majority of the time with this position talking to and calling back Sellers.

Previous successful phone experience A MUST!



Looking for someone to run and follow up on my day to day real estate LEADS.

Responsibilities include:



1.

Updating CRM leads (REIControl experience preferred!)



2.

Cold Calling leads, Cold Calling leads, and more cold calling leads



3.

Researching Properties and pulling comps



4.

Talking to sellers and making ballpark offers (you better be able to handle rejection and sellers getting upset as this is a constant)



5.

Having a daily
 call with team to go over your work



6. Anything else that I may think of





Experience is a plus but being hard working and RELIABLE employee is preferred. Pay is hourly for work plus opportunity for weekly BONUS plus TEAM BONUS based on quarterly numbers of the company!



Must have reliable computer with internet connections (No excuses will be tolerated for missing work!), be able to work U.S.A hours, and be positive, outgoing, and flexible. Positive attitudes only also! We need a KAMPEON and we strive to get better each and every day to be our best! If you are not committed to getting better, you will not be a good fit.



When you reply to this job posting in the Title put the Word "CHIEFS" so I know you are a person and can follow directions. Also, please attach a voice recording of yourself and tell me a little bit about yourself and why I should hire you! If you do not follow these directions, you will not be considered! I look forward to talking to my next rock star!

title: Full-time Sales Executive role
description:
Join Our Australian Sales Team!

Are you looking to build your sales career with an industry leader? Our company is seeking two full-time Sales Representatives to join our dynamic team!



About Us

With over 30 years of experience, our company is the market leader in disability and materials handling stair climbers. We pride ourselves on our proven sales strategies and strong customer relationships, consistently averaging 10-20 sales per month.



The Role

title: Sales and Clients management
description:

Baaraku helps U.S. businesses hire high-quality remote professionals, including Virtual Assistants, Tech Talent, and Digital Marketing specialists. Our clients are startup founders, e-commerce companies, SaaS businesses, and growing companies across the United States.



In this role, you will be responsible for speaking with qualified prospects, understanding their hiring needs, and closing them as clients.



This is not a cold calling role. We provide a minimum of 80 pre-qualified leads per month. Your focus will be on conducting discovery calls, presenting our services, following up, and closing deals.



Responsibilities

Conduct sales calls via Google Meet or Zoom



Understand client needs and recommend the right staffing solution



Present Baaraku’s services clearly and professionally



Close new clients

Commission: $50 for every successful closed client



Minimum of 80 qualified leads provided monthly



Unlimited earning potential based on performance



Requirements



Strong English communication skills (spoken and written)



Experience in sales, appointment setting, or closing



Comfortable speaking with U.S. business owners

Reliable internet connection



Self-motivated and results-driven

B2B sales experience



Experience selling services, outsourcing, or staffing

Work Setup



Remote work (work from home)



Must be available during U.S. business hours when needed



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who is serious about sales and wants to grow with a fast-growing international company.

title: Sr. Cleaning Operations Manager (Remote)
description:

We are looking for a Senior Cleaning Operations Manager who has owned cleaning fulfillment end-to-end and can run day-to-day operations without supervision.

Cleaner sourcing, onboarding, and retention



Daily scheduling and last-minute replacements



Quality assurance systems



Client issue resolution and escalations



City-level performance tracking



SOP execution and improvement



Managing junior VAs if needed



You are expected to own outcomes, not “support” someone else.



What This Role Is NOT



Not an assistant role



Not a task-only VA position



Not a training role



Not a micromanaged position



If you need step-by-step instructions, this is not a fit.

Full-time Role with a company that has 8 Person VA TEAM

If you've used BookingKoala to manage jobs and have experience finding cleaners via FB, this job will be a piece of cake for you



Applications without real experience will not be considered.

title: Real Estate Content Video Editor
description:
Job Posting: Real Estate Video Editor (Long-Form + Short-Form)



Part-Time / Contract – Remote



IMPORTANT: If you have ZERO experience creating content for real estate, and/or experience working with real estate clients, please do NOT apply. Thank you**



We’re looking for a dedicated, skilled, creative Video Editor with experience editing content in the real estate industry** who can turn raw footage into clean, polished, engaging videos designed to educate home buyers and sellers, build trust, and drive lead generation for real estate agents.



If you can skillfully edit both long-form (YouTube) and short-form vertical videos (Reels/Shorts/TikTok) with clean captions, strong pacing, and a modern style, at a quick turnaround time — you’ll be a great fit.



About the Role:

- You will edit ongoing video content for real estate agents, including:

           - Educational YouTube videos

           - Market update videos

           - Buyer/seller tips

           - Short-form vertical videos

           - Video ads for
, Instagram, and YouTube

           - Listing or neighborhood b-roll overlays when needed

We will provide raw clips, brand guidelines, examples, and clear notes for each project.



What We’re Looking For / Required Skills:

- Experience editing different styles of real estate videos catered to different avatars (luxury, first time buyers, home owners, sellers, motivated sellers, downsizers, etc

- Strong short-form editing skills: hooks, pacing, pattern interrupts

- Clean, modern captioning (not overly stylized)

- Ability to edit for multiple platforms:

         - 9:16 Reels/Shorts

         - 16:9 YouTube

         - 1:1
 feed (optional but preferred)

- Strong audio cleanup (noise reduction, clarity, leveling)

- Basic color correction

- Familiarity with real estate content (buyer/seller education, listing videos, etc.)

- Reliable turnaround time and communication



Qualifications:

      - Proven Video Editing Expertise: proficiency in video editing with a keen eye for creativity, storytelling, and detail.

      - Creative Vision: Ability to exhibit creative, innovative flair and storytelling to projects

      - Adaptability: Flexibility to adjust to changing creative directions and project requirements.

      - Ability to adjust editing style and messaging for distinct audiences—such as luxury buyers, first-time home buyers, distressed home sellers

      - Has the drive, hunger, and ability to do whatever it takes to materialize the creative vision and make deadlines



Bonus Skills (Preferred):

- Thumbnail creation

- Motion graphics

- Understanding of real estate compliance (no guarantees, no misleading claims)

- Experience with YouTube retention-focused editing



Responsibilities:

        - Edit long-form and short-form videos in a clean, modern style

        - Add captions using on-brand styling

        - Add b-roll, graphics, and minimal effects where appropriate

        - Maintain consistent pacing and high retention

        - Export in the correct aspect ratios and file formats

        - Deliver revisions in a timely manner

        - excellent/reliable communication

        - reliable internet/power connections

        - Organize files properly within Drive/Dropbox



Tools You Should Be Comfortable With:

         - Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or CapCut Pro

         - Google Drive / Dropbox

         - Basic audio enhancement tools

         - Canva or Photoshop for thumbnails



Turnaround Expectations:

       - Short-form videos: 24–48 hours

       - Long-form videos: 3–5 days

Batch projects: timelines provided per batch



Reliability and communication is very important.



Compensation:

         - Rates will depend on experience and skills.

Please provide:

           - Your rate per short-form video

           - Your rate for long-form edits (
+ minutes)

           - Your monthly retainer options (optional)



How to Apply:

Please submit:

        - Your real estate editing portfolio

        - (Reels/Shorts + YouTube long-form examples required)

        - A brief note about your experience with real estate content

        - resume

        - The tools/software you use

        - Availability (hours/week)

        - upload 2–3 of your best short-form reels

        - upload 2-3 of your best long form videos

        - Your rates and typical turnaround time



What Happens Next:

        - Shortlisted candidates will be given a paid test edit to evaluate creativity, style, pacing, captions, and delivery.



P.S., if you have ZERO experience in any of these fields, no portfolio of past real estate works, or cannot fulfill requirements-------please do NOT apply.  Thank you!

How to Apply

Your updated resume.



A voice or video recording introducing yourself and describing your experience booking appointments for Australian property investment companies.

Ready to join a successful Australian company where hard work and talent are rewarded? Apply now – we’re excited to meet our next top-performing appointment setter!

title: Junior Media Buyer
description:
Job Title: Junior Media Buyer

Type: Full-time

Compensation: £250-£300/week

Reporting to: Director of Paid Media



WHO WE ARE



Digital Roo is a UK-based lead generation company that partners with financial service brands to deliver high-quality, compliant, and scalable leads.



We combine expert media buying, creative strategy, and automation to help our clients grow predictably across platforms like Meta, Google, Bing, YouTube, and TikTok.



We’re scaling fast — with major growth plans for 2026 — and we’re building a small, world-class team to help us get there.



THE ROLE



We're looking for someone smart, curious, and eager to learn — not necessarily someone who already knows everything about media buying.



This is a learn-on-the-job role where you'll be trained to become a high-performing media buyer using modern tools, AI, and data-driven strategies.



You'll start with campaign setup, monitoring, and analysis — then gradually take on more responsibility as you prove yourself. Within 6 months, you could be managing your own campaigns and budgets.



RESPONSIBILITIES



Month 1-2: Learn the Fundamentals



Shadow our media buying process across Meta, Google, and other platforms

Set up campaigns using Google Ads Editor and Meta Ads Manager (we'll teach you)

Monitor daily performance and flag any issues or opportunities

Learn how to read data: CTR, CPA, conversion rates, and what they mean

Assist with creative briefing and A/B test tracking



Month 3-5: Own Your First Campaigns



Manage smaller test budgets independently

Run weekly performance analysis and suggest optimizations

Collaborate with the creative team to test new ad angles

Start building "recovery plans" when campaigns underperform



Month 6-12: Become a Growth Strategist



Own full campaign lifecycles from setup to scale

Identify new platform opportunities (TikTok, Native, Bing, etc.)

Present performance insights to clients or internal stakeholders

Propose and execute growth experiments





YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU…



* Are a fast learner: You don't need to know media buying now, but you need to pick things up quickly.

* Love numbers: You're comfortable with spreadsheets and can spot patterns in data.

* Are naturally curious: You ask "why" and "what if" constantly.

* Take ownership: You don't wait to be told what to do — you figure it out.

* Communicate clearly: You can explain your thinking and findings in writing.

* Are proactive: If something's broken, you fix it. If something's unclear, you ask.



REQUIREMENTS

* Comfortable with Google Sheets or Excel (formulas, pivot tables are a plus but not required).

* Basic understanding of digital advertising (even if just from using
/Instagram).

* Familiarity with marketing metrics (CPC, CPA, ROAS, CTR, etc.)

* Willingness to learn technical tools: Google Ads Editor, Meta Ads Manager, tracking systems

* English Fluency: Excellent written and spoken English for internal meetings and ad copy testing.

* Analytical Mindset: You must be comfortable with complex data interpretation and presenting findings to the team.

* A strong interest in AI, marketing, and scalable business systems.



Nice to have:

* Any prior experience with paid ads (even personal projects or small freelance work)

* Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini

* Experience in marketing, eCommerce, or analytics roles



Most Important:



* You're hungry to grow and see this as a career opportunity, not just a job

* You're detail-oriented — small mistakes in media buying can cost thousands

* You're resilient — campaigns fail sometimes; you learn and move forward





WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT



* Direct Impact: You’ll be working directly with the paid media director in a high-growth environment. Your decisions will move the needle every single day.

* Continuous Learning: We move fast. You’ll be expected to learn new tools (including AI-driven workflows) and improve your strategy weekly.

* Data-First Culture: We don’t guess. We test, analyze, and iterate. If you love performance marketing, you’ll love our process.

* A-Player Environment: We only hire smart, capable, self-motivated people. There is zero hand-holding here—just ownership and results.









HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please complete our short survey first (link below).

Only applications submitted through the survey will be considered.



>> 



If selected, you’ll receive an invitation to an initial interview.



OUR HIRING PROCESS



1. Survey/Quiz – Complete a short questionnaire to assess fit and attention to detail.

2. Initial Interview – A brief conversation to learn more about you.

3. Paid Test Task – Selected candidates complete a real-world task (2–3 hours) to demonstrate skills.

4. Final Interview & Offer – Final alignment and next-step discussion.

(In some cases, we may bring on multiple candidates for a one-month trial and keep the best performers.)



SUMMARY



If you're someone who's smart, driven, and ready to learn fast — this is your chance to build a real career in performance marketing.

You'll learn, grow, and work inside an ambitious, AI-powered company. If you're curious about how modern marketing works and want to become exceptional at it, this is the role.





>> Apply now by completing the survey linked above.

description:
URGENT HIRING. MUST HAVE EXPERIENCED IN ECOMMERCE



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are seeking a confident and experienced tea
mber who can independently oversee e-commerce operations, take proactive initiative, and consistently deliver results with minimal supervision, ensuring long-term success and stability in the role.



Key Responsibilities:



- Serve as the Point-in-Charge (PIC) and technical expert for the BigSeller platform, providing system guidance, troubleshooting, and workflow optimization.

- Stay updated on BigSeller feature releases and system enhancements, implementing updates to improve operational efficiency.

- Manage product listings across multiple online platforms (Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Shop), ensuring accuracy, quality, and completeness (basic photo editing and product research).

- Monitor pricing strategies and campaign promotions (e.g., 11.11, 12.12, Payday Sales) to drive sales growth performance.

- Track and analyze sales data, competitor activity, inventory levels, and shipment status, preparing actionable performance reports.

- Confidently present weekly and monthly data to management, translating complex metrics into clear strategies.

- Maintain overall e-commerce account health, coordinating with teams to resolve customer service issues, refunds, returns, and fraud cases.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide ad-hoc support for campaigns and special projects.



Qualifications:



- 2–3 years of hands-on experience managing e-commerce operations on Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Seller Centre or Account, or similar is required.

- Strong understanding of online campaign management, pricing strategies, and platform algorithms.

- Proficient in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables), and generating performance reports.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: $$$ Hiring Meta Ads Video Editor • U.S E-Com Brand • Long-Term Growth ????
description:
Summary

Location: Remote

Hours: 20 hours/week (with potential to transition to full-time)

Compensation: $800/month + performance bonuses



About Lymphlite

Lymphlite is a rapidly growing e-commerce brand revolutionizing the lymphatic health space. We help women over 45 rediscover comfort and confidence by addressing swollen legs through natural, science-backed solutions. Our mission is to make a real difference in our customers' lives, and we're building a brand that stands for authenticity, efficacy, and empowerment.

As we scale our Meta advertising campaigns, we need a talented video editor who can combine technical expertise with creative vision and cutting-edge AI tools to produce high-converting ad creatives.



The Role

We're looking for a part-time Video Editor (20 hours/week) to join our creative team and take our Meta ads to the next level. This isn't just about cutting footage—it's about crafting compelling stories that resonate with our audience and drive results.

This is a long-term opportunity. If you excel during the trial period, we're ready to transition you to full-time and offer performance-based bonuses when your creatives win.



What You'll Be Doing

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



Footage Research & Selection: Finding and selecting high-quality B-roll footage that perfectly aligns with our scripts and brand messaging

Video Editing: Creating polished, engaging video ads using CapCut or similar editing software

AI-Powered Content Creation:



Generating dynamic B-roll scenes using Higgsfield (including models like Sora 2)

Producing long-form and UGC-style videos with Arcads AI

Crafting compelling prompts to maximize AI output quality





Voiceover Production: Using ElevenLabs to generate natural, persuasive voiceovers

Creative Testing: Producing multiple variations of ads to test different angles, hooks, and formats

Collaboration: Working closely with our marketing team to understand campaign objectives and iterate based on performance data





What We're Looking For

Required Skills:



Proven experience with Higgsfield for AI-generated video content (this is non-negotiable)

Strong proficiency with Arcads AI for UGC and long-form video production

Experience with ElevenLabs for AI voice generation

Solid video editing skills using CapCut or similar tools (Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

Excellent prompt engineering abilities to get the best results from AI tools

Portfolio showcasing creative video work (especially for Meta ads or e-commerce)



Personality Traits:



Dynamic & Proactive: You don't wait to be told what to do—you take initiative and suggest improvements

Highly Responsive: You communicate clearly and respond promptly

Creative Mindset: You bring fresh ideas and aren't afraid to experiment

Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for quality and polish

Results-Driven: You understand that the goal is performance, not just pretty videos



Bonus Points:



Previous experience creating Meta ads or direct response creatives

Experience in the health/wellness e-commerce space

Understanding of what makes ads convert (hooks, pain points, storytelling)

Familiarity with ad performance metrics and A/B testing





What We Offer

Compensation Structure:



Starting Rate: $800/month for 20 hours/week

Trial Period: 1-month evaluation period

Performance Bonuses: After the trial period, you'll earn bonuses when your creatives are winners (driving strong ROAS)

Growth Opportunity: Transition to full-time with increased compensation for top performers

Creative Freedom: We value your input and encourage you to bring your ideas to the table

Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with a stable internet connection





How to Apply

To be considered for this position, please submit:



Your CV/Resume

Portfolio or Work Samples (especially Meta ads, AI-generated content, or e-commerce creatives)

Brief Cover Letter answering these questions:



What's your experience with Higgsfield, Arcads AI, and ElevenLabs?

Share an example of a creative you're proud of and explain why it performed well

What makes you the right fit for this role?





Availability: Confirm you can commit to 20 hours/week



We're excited to find someone who shares our vision and is ready to make an impact. If you're a creative problem-solver who thrives on producing winning ads, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (Hospitality) — Book Manchester Trade Wine Tasting RSVPs
description:
Overview

We’re a UK wine importer focused on small-batch, grower-made Languedoc wines. We run central Manchester trade tastings and need a strong cold caller to reach the wine decision maker, qualify by wine list refresh timing, and book qualified RSVPs into specific tasting slots. Professional, clear, jargon-light communication is essential.



What you’ll do (core responsibilities)

 • Cold call restaurants, wine bars and independent venues (Manchester focus; lead list provided).

 • Get past gatekeepers and speak to the person responsible for the wine list.

 • Qualify prospects using our checklist:

 • Next wine list refresh window (month/week)

 • Venue style fit (natural / mixed / classic)

 • BTG price band + bottle price band

 • Confirm decision maker attendance (or direct list influencer)

 • Book RSVPs into fixed tasting slots (Wave 1 / Wave 2) via our calendar link.

 • Capture and log full contact details (name, role,
, mobile) and all required notes in our sheet/form.

 • Send confirmation + reminders (templates provided) to reduce no-shows.



Outputs we require (non-negotiable)

A booking only counts if it is a qualified RSVP with:

 • Named attendee(s) + role(s)

 •
 + mobile

 • Confirmed slot (Wave 1 / Wave 2)

 • Logged wine list refresh window

 • Logged BTG/bottle price bands

 • Clean CRM/log completion (all mandatory fields)



Experience required

 • Proven cold calling/appointment setting experience, ideally in hospitality (restaurants/bars) or similar B2B.

 • Confident handling gatekeepers and objections.

 • Strong spoken English + professional phone manner.

 • Excellent note-taking and CRM hygiene.



Hours & calling window

 • Start: 10–20 hours/week (can scale).

 • Calling window: UK business hours, 11:00–17:00 UK time.



Payment & incentives (performance-based)

We pay for outcomes (attendance + orders), not dials.



Option A - Hourly + attended RSVP bounty 

 • Hourly: $5–$10/hr 

 •     Attended qualified RSVP bounty: $10 per attended RSVP



What counts as a “qualified RSVP” (mandatory to be paid):

To be paid, ALL must be captured and the attendee must show:

 1. Attendee is the wine list decision maker (or direct list influencer)

 2.
 + mobile captured

 3. Confirmed slot (Wave 1 / Wave 2)

 4. Next list refresh window logged (month/week)

 5. BTG + bottle price bands logged

 6. Venue + location area logged

 7. Confirmation + reminders sent (templates provided)



No payout for unqualified bookings, incomplete logs, or no-shows.



Shortlisted candidates will complete a 2 hour test with a small lead list. 

We will assess: phone approach, objection handling, booking quality, and data capture accuracy.

title: HR & Operations Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:



The HR & Operations Coordinator plays an active, multi-disciplinary role in the Company’s central team, primarily focusing on engaging applicants through available online tools and in-person interactions, conducting screenings and interviews, as well as assisting in the onboarding and training activities. This position works closely with other members of the HR, Compliance, Operations, and Payroll teams to ensure that we hire, retain, the best carers.



This role requires an experienced candidate who is a creative and critical thinker, is extremely organised, detail-oriented, and results-focused. The right candidate must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work equally well individually and in a team setting.



Minimum Qualifications:



- Bachelor’s Degree and at least one year of experience in recruiting, human resources, or business operations.



- Experience in health care or other service industries is preferred.



- Proven experience handling data or administrative workflows.



Essential Functions:



Recruitment & HR:



- Screening and interviewing applicants (conducting phone and video interviews).



- Conducting phone and
/text outreach campaigns to attract talent.



- Assisting in the onboarding and training activities for new hires.



Compliance:



- Assisting in the review and management of personnel files for all carers to ensure "audit readiness".



- Conducting due diligence checks, including chasing References, Right to Work documentation, and DBS (criminal record) checks.



Operations & Payroll:



- Collating and verifying timesheets from carers, ensuring accuracy before payroll processing.



- Preparing figures and entering data into payroll and rostering systems for senior sign-off.



- Assisting with the creation of weekly/monthly rotas and operational reports.



General:



- Participating and contributing to HR and Tea
etings.



- Assisting with other office functions and administrative tasks as necessary.



- Supporting the Company’s overall goal and mission of delivering quality care.



Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:



- A passion for the care sector and supporting our service users.



- Have knowledge of the UK care industry (preferred).



- Advanced computer skills, including proficient use of Microsoft Office 365. Must be highly skilled in Excel (formulas/data formatting), Word, SharePoint, and PowerPoint.



- General knowledge of employment laws and practices.



- A positive attitude with a passion for working with people and performing meaningful work.



- The ability to manage multiple tasks at once (e.g., recruitment and payroll deadlines) and prioritise goals.



- Ability to demonstrate critical thinking and resolution to daily challenges—a "systems thinker" who spots process improvements.



- Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to listen effectively.



- Sound judgement and decision-making skills.



- The ability to work independently to meet challenging goals and deadlines.



- Experience working collaboratively within a team of peers.



- The ability to demonstrate discretion, integrity, and fair-mindedness consistent with company standards, practices, policies, and procedures.



Success Factors:



- Positive, professional, business image.



- Ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words.



- Ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand (Clear, professional English).



- Ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.



- Ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.



- Ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.



- Ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.



This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee will be expected to perform other reasonable related duties as assigned.



Working Schedule: UK Business Hours (e.g., 09:00 – 17:00 GMT/BST) Working Environment: Remote (Must have a dedicated home office setup with high-speed internet).



As a part of your application, please send a short video of up to two minutes introducing yourself and outlining your interest in the role to:

title: Quality Checker – Video & Podcast Content
description:
Are you obsessed with pixel-perfect content and catching every tiny mistake before it goes live? Do you have an eagle eye for spotting errors in captions, cuts, and video transitions? If so, we want you on our team!



Who We Are

37 Projects is the #1 Video Podcast Marketing Service for Health Experts and Wellness Brands. We handle everything from post-production to publishing, ensuring our clients' podcasts and video content are polished, engaging, and ready for the spotlight.



Your Role

As a Quality Checker, you will be the final checkpoint before our content is published. Your job is to meticulously review and ensure top-tier quality for podcast videos, clips, and shorts.



Responsibilities:

- Review full podcast videos, clips, and shorts for quality control before publishing

- Ensure clean and smooth cuts without awkward transitions or missing frames

- Check for subtitle accuracy (grammar, spelling, timing, readability)

- Verify lower-thirds, graphics, and animations are correctly placed and aligned

- Detect and flag glitches, black screens, mismatched audio, and visual errors

- Maintain consistent branding across all content

- Provide detailed feedback to editors on necessary revisions

- Ensure final deliverables meet client expectations and 37 Projects' quality standards



Requirements:

- Experience in video content quality control (podcasts, YouTube videos, or social media content preferred)

- Strong attention to detail and ability to catch small yet critical mistakes

- Familiarity with video editing tools (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar) is a plus

- Basic knowledge of captions, lower-thirds, and graphic overlays

- Ability to work efficiently under tight deadlines

- Excellent communication skills to provide feedback to editors



Why Join Us?

- Be part of a fast-growing video marketing agency

- Fully remote work with flexible hours

- Work with top health and wellness experts

- Engage with high-quality podcast content before anyone else



If you’re ready to elevate content quality and ensure that only the best videos go live, we’d love to hear from you!



Apply now by filling up this form:

title: Podcast Video Editor – Remote (Freelance/Part-Time)
description:
About 37 Projects

We are a leading video podcast marketing agency specializing in health and wellness content. We manage YouTube growth for top experts, nutritionists, and medical professionals, helping their content reach the right audience. Now, we’re looking for a Podcast Video Editor to join our team!



Role Overview

We need a highly skilled Podcast Video Editor who can turn long-form podcast recordings into engaging, well-paced video content. You will be responsible for cleaning up raw footage, cutting unnecessary parts, ensuring smooth pacing, enhancing audio, and making the final video visually polished and professional.



Your main goal is to edit full-length podcast episodes (30-90 minutes) and clips from those podcasts while maintaining a natural and engaging flow. Audio quality is just as important as video quality, so experience in audio enhancement and noise reduction is required.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit long-form podcast videos (30-90 minutes) into polished, high-quality content

- Cut out filler words, awkward pauses, and unnecessary sections to keep the conversation engaging

- Enhance and balance audio for clarity, reducing background noise and ensuring consistent levels

- Apply light audio processing (EQ, compression, noise removal) for professional sound

- Ensure smooth transitions, multi-camera switching (if applicable), and high production value

- Create shorter clips (3-10 minutes) from full episodes (timestamps will be provided)

- Deliver export-ready files in landscape (16:9) format



Who You Are

- Experienced Podcast Video Editor—you have edited long-form conversations before

- Proficient in Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro

- Strong understanding of pacing & storytelling—you know how to keep viewers engaged

- Skilled in multi-camera editing, color correction, and professional podcast aesthetics

- Experienced in audio editing—you can remove background noise, balance audio, and improve clarity

- Familiar with tools like Adobe Audition, RX iZotope, or similar for audio processing

- Able to work efficiently without sacrificing quality

- Detail-oriented—clean cuts, proper text placement, and smooth edits

- Fast and reliable—you can meet deadlines consistently



How We Work: Our 4 Core Principles

At 37 Projects, every team member is expected to uphold these principles:

Competence – Continuously improve skills, deliver high-quality work, and make strategic decisions that align with client goals.

Commitment – Be reliable, meet deadlines, and take full ownership of responsibilities.

Character – Maintain professionalism, integrity, and a solution-oriented mindset.

Communication – Provide clear, timely updates, acknowledge messages, and collaborate effectively with the team.



These principles ensure we remain a high-performing and aligned team delivering excellence to our clients.



How to Apply (Screening Test Included)

To ensure the best fit for this role, we’re asking all applicants to complete a short test task along with their application.



1, Fill out this application form: https://forms.gle/WwjXs4WoaQn54MQx6



2. Complete the test task:

- Download the raw podcast video footage from this link: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14k7TMRc5cMmvdCkeXmnre5F5SDcFhFr9?usp=sharing



- Edit a 15 minute video from the provided raw footage.

- Ensure smooth cuts, clear pacing, and professional quality.

- Enhance the audio by removing noise, balancing levels, and applying necessary processing.



Upload your final edited video here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ulWwbAEv2V1i71jkpXD3u--P7XarJSOK?usp=sharing



Goal: Show us your ability to create engaging podcast edits with clean visuals and clear, professional audio.



Only shortlisted candidates will be invited for a short video interview.

nts.

nt” to open the trailer.

title: Project Manager / YouTube Podcast Producer (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About Us



37 Projects is a fast-growing YouTube podcast marketing agency working with leading health, wellness, and performance brands (e.g., doctors, nutritionists, coaches, and creators).

We handle full post-production - from editing, SEO titles, and thumbnails to Shorts and publishing - helping clients grow from zero to hundreds of thousands of subscribers.



We’re looking for a Project Manager / Podcast Producer to manage two weekly podcasts and their related content.

This person will oversee production, review creative output, and ensure every piece, from full episodes to Shorts and thumbnails, aligns with the client’s brand identity, visual style, and storytelling tone.



This is a hybrid role: part creative producer, part project manager.

You’ll coordinate editors, review video quality, manage delivery timelines, and collaborate with our internal Creative Director and YouTube Strategist.



Responsibilities

Production & Coordination

- Oversee post-production for 2 podcasts per week, including:

  +2 full episodes (long-form)

  + 4 clips (3–10 minutes)

  + 10 Shorts (up to 60 seconds)

- Manage and coordinate between the Long-form Video Editor, Shorts Editor, Graphic Designer, and VA.

- Track and update tasks through Notion boards and Google Sheets production tracker.

- Review all 
 drafts, ensuring smooth communication and quick feedback cycles.

- Ensure editors meet deadlines and maintain consistent output quality.



Creative Oversight

- Review all deliverables for video quality, captions, and visual alignment with the client’s brand.

- Collaborate with the Creative Director on overall look and feel, ensuring videos reflect the right tone, pacing, and emotional flow.

- Guarantee that thumbnails align with the client’s visual branding (color palette, tone, layout consistency).

- Work closely with the YouTube Strategist who provides SEO titles and descriptions, ensuring the final uploads reflect both storytelling and search strategy.

- Maintain consistent quality standards across all episodes, clips, and Shorts.



Client Communication

- Act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients.

- Send regular progress updates and manage expectations clearly.

- Handle client feedback and ensure revisions are properly implemented.

- Communicate deadlines and deliverables clearly and professionally.



Admin & Reporting

- Update Notion boards daily with progress, feedback, and approvals.

- Monitor deadlines and coordinate with the VA for uploads, metadata, timestamps, and playlists.

- Collaborate with the team to identify creative or technical improvements.



Skills & Experience

- 2+ years of experience as a Project Manager, Producer, or Account Manager in a creative, media, or marketing agency.

- Strong understanding of video post-production and YouTube podcast workflows.

- Excellent communication skills (English written & verbal).

- High attention to detail and strong visual judgment — must have an eye for branding, quality, and storytelling flow.

- Experience using 
, Notion, Slack, Google Workspace, and similar tools.

- Organized, proactive, and able to manage multiple deadlines across teams.



Bonus Skills (Preferred, Not Required)

- Experience with YouTube or podcast video production.

- Basic understanding of YouTube SEO and content optimization.

- Familiarity with analytics, performance tracking, and CTR/retention metrics.

- Experience working with international clients (US, UK, AU).



What You’ll Get

- Work with top-tier health, performance, and wellness experts from around the world.

- Learn advanced YouTube strategy systems, production workflows, and creative processes used to scale shows from 0 to 100K+ subscribers.

- Join a high-performance, respectful, and growth-driven remote team.

- Opportunities for long-term growth within 37 Projects as we continue to expand.



How to apply

Please fill up this form without using any AI tools (in your own words). Candidates that will use AI will be disqualified.

title: YouTube Shorts Video Editor (with After Effects)
description:
About 37 Projects

We are the #1 Video Podcast Marketing Service for Health & Performance Brands.

We help top experts, nutritionists, doctors, and wellness professionals grow their YouTube presence with engaging, high-quality content.

Now we’re hiring a YouTube Shorts Video Editor with advanced motion graphics skills to join our growing team.





Role Overview

We’re looking for an editor who specializes in fast-paced, high-retention YouTube Shorts and is highly skilled in After Effects motion graphics.

Your work must go beyond simple cutting—you must be able to enhance storytelling through kinetic typography, animated elements, transitions, and visually dynamic scenes.



You’ll be given raw footage and reference edits. Your job: replicate the style, elevate it, and deliver polished 9:16 vertical videos.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit 60–90 second YouTube Shorts using high-retention editing techniques.

- Create custom motion graphics in After Effects (this is a MUST).

- Design high-quality kinetic text, animated highlights, and visual callouts.

- Use smooth transitions, multilayer motion graphics, and dynamic visual pacing.

- Add sound design: music, subtle SFX, and emphasis pops.

- Apply accurate, engaging captions styled for high retention.

- Follow the editing style of our provided samples (Types C, D, E).

- Deliver export-ready 9:16 vertical videos optimized for YouTube Shorts.



Who You Are

- You’ve edited high-retention short-form content (YouTube Shorts, Reels, TikTok).

- You have advanced After Effects motion graphics skills—non-negotiable.

- You’re skilled in Premiere Pro (or DaVinci Resolve) and integrate AE seamlessly.

- You understand dynamic pacing and storytelling for vertical video.

- You can create clean, modern motion design that enhances clarity and emotion.

- Strong sense of design: timing, spacing, typography, colors, visual rhythm.

- Excellent sound design skills: enhancing beats, transitions, and emotional peaks.

- Attention to detail: no choppy cuts, no awkward pauses, no sloppy captions.

- Fast, reliable, and able to deliver consistent high-quality results.



Our 4 Core Principles at 37 Projects

Competence – Always improve, deliver your best, and think strategically.
